metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25212 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A TOCTOU mismatch in the NFS client code in the Linux kernel before 5.8.3could be used by local attackers to corrupt memory or possibly haveunspecified other impact because a size check is in fs/nfs/nfs4proc.cinstead of fs/nfs/nfs4xdr.c, aka CID-b4487b935452.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-121.123
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-121.123').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
